title: Peregrine lunar lander on Earth reentry trajectory
summary: Astrobotic says its Peregrine spacecraft, unable to land on the moon because of a propellant leak, will instead reenter the Earth’s atmosphere in the coming days.

title: SpaceX says propellant venting caused loss of second Starship
summary: SpaceX Chief Executive Elon Musk says a propellant dump caused the destruction of the Starship upper stage on a November test flight, giving him confidence that the vehicle can reach orbit on its next launch.

title: Virtual Event – Not Invisible Anymore: How satellites monitor atmospheric methane
summary: Coming out of the United Nations climate change conference, methane is in the spotlight. International experts see cutting methane emissions as a key to slowing climate change. A growing fleet […]

title: UK-Based Blue Abyss to Build Astronaut Training Facility in Ohio
summary:
Blue Abyss has announced that it has completed the purchase of 12 acres of land in Brook Park, Ohio, that will be used to build an extreme environment research, development, and training centre. The Blue Abyss Centre, which will also feature a hotel, will be built adjacent to the Cleveland Hopkins International Airport, a stone’s […]
The post UK-Based Blue Abyss to Build Astronaut Training Facility in Ohio appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Jupiter-3 enters commercial service
summary: EchoStar’s giant Jupiter-3 broadband satellite is performing as expected with early customers getting download speeds of up to 100 megabits per second, according to an executive for the U.S. operator.

title: With a Week to Go, House in Disarray Over Funding as Partial Shutdown Looms
summary: Despite agreement among the four key congressional leaders on top level funding for FY2024, the threat of a partial government shutdown a week from now is as real as ever.  […]

title: Momentus, low on cash, delays next mission
summary: In-space transportation company Momentus has postponed the next flight of its space tug and laid off a fifth of its staff to conserve its dwindling cash reserves.

title: Analysis: Earth to the Moon – The Future of Commercial Human Spaceflight
summary: Twelve years ago, Space Shuttle Atlantis came to a final stop at the Shuttle Landing Facility at Kennedy Space Center, ending NASA’s three decade long shuttle program. Despite the immense achievements of the iconic Space Shuttle, there was a profound emptiness to the United States’ space program. Without the Shuttle, there was no longer domestic crew access to space.

title: Space company Momentus, once valued at more than $1 billion, is running dangerously low on money
summary: Space company Momentus warned shareholders in a securities filing on Friday that the company is running out of money and does not have a financial lifeline.

title: Rocket Report: A Chinese launch you must see; Vulcan’s stunning debut
